# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " $(word)"
        end
    end

    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    join(lines; separator="\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("This is a long string that needs to be wrapped at every 10 characters")
"This is a long string that needs to be \nwrapped at every 10 characters"

julia> wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", 20)
"The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
```
